definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Now. If you want to look at freezing point depression, it's really easy.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想看凝固点降低，这很简单。

sentences.english: The method is subject to greater experimental errors than the freezing-point-depression method .
sentences.chinese: 此方法比凝固点低压法易发生更大的实验误差。

sentences.english: The freezing point of the windscreen cleaner can be read off here.
sentences.chinese: 可由此读取风挡清洁剂的凝固点。

sentences.english: The freezing point has been determined out 478.
sentences.chinese: 用凝固点下降法测定了产品的分子量为478。

sentences.english: When we're doing freezing point depression, we're going from liquid to solid.
sentences.chinese: 凝固点降低的时候，我们要从液体到固体。

sentences.english: Particle size is the reason; different freezing points are the effect.
sentences.chinese: 尺寸的大小是原因，不同的凝固点是影响。

sentences.english: The method is subject to greater experimental errors than the freezing-point-depression method.
sentences.chinese: 此方法比凝固点降低法易发生更大的实验误差。

definition: fraction (of a distillate)/key (one component part of a distillate)
cetane number (quality of light diesel fuel, measured by its ignition delay)
